After how many years did water bodies form on Earth?

short_answers.question: What is meant by life on Earth?
short_answers.answer: Life on Earth refers to the existence of living organisms on the planet Earth.

short_answers.question: When was the solar system formed?
short_answers.answer: The solar system was formed about 4.5 billion years ago.

short_answers.question: Why is Earth unique among planets?
short_answers.answer: Earth is the only planet known to support life.

short_answers.question: When did water bodies appear on Earth?
short_answers.answer: Water bodies appeared about 80 crore years after Earth cooled.

short_answers.question: Where did life first begin?
short_answers.answer: Life first began in water.

short_answers.question: What are protozoa?
short_answers.answer: Protozoa are unicellular living organisms.

short_answers.question: Why are protozoa not visible to naked eyes?
short_answers.answer: They are extremely small in size.

short_answers.question: Which tool helps us see unicellular organisms?
short_answers.answer: A microscope helps us see unicellular organisms.

short_answers.question: Name any two characteristics of animals.
short_answers.answer: Animals breathe and can move.

short_answers.question: How do animals reproduce?
short_answers.answer: Some animals lay eggs while others give birth.

short_answers.question: How was the sun formed?
short_answers.answer: The sun was formed from a huge cloud of hot gases and dust.

short_answers.question: How were planets formed?
short_answers.answer: Planets were formed from parts of the gas cloud revolving around the sun.

short_answers.question: Name the planets in the solar system.
short_answers.answer: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.

short_answers.question: Why was life expected on Mars?
short_answers.answer: Because Mars has ice, atmosphere and soil components.

short_answers.question: Why does life not exist on Mars?
short_answers.answer: Because liquid water is not present on Mars.

short_answers.question: What gases are present on Mars?
short_answers.answer: Mars has carbon dioxide and small amounts of oxygen.

short_answers.question: What is Mangalyaan?
short_answers.answer: Mangalyaan is India's Mars mission spacecraft.

short_answers.question: When did Mangalyaan reach Mars?
short_answers.answer: Mangalyaan reached Mars on 24 September 2014.

short_answers.question: What do animals need to survive?
short_answers.answer: Animals need food, water and air to survive.

short_answers.question: What two groups make up the living world?
short_answers.answer: Plants and animals make up the living world.
